## Pre-Course Checklist

### 2 Weeks Before
- [ ] Review complete course materials
- [ ] Set up demo environment
- [ ] Test all code examples
- [ ] Prepare student accounts/access
- [ ] Send pre-course welcome email
- [ ] Share pre-work assignments

### 1 Week Before
- [ ] Finalize class roster
- [ ] Review student prerequisites
- [ ] Customize examples for audience
- [ ] Prepare backup materials
- [ ] Test video conferencing (if virtual)
- [ ] Prepare attendance tracking

### Day Before Each Session
- [ ] Review session plan
- [ ] Test demos and exercises
- [ ] Prepare answer key reference
- [ ] Check recording setup
- [ ] Prepare icebreaker/warm-up

---

## Session Delivery Guide

### Standard Session Flow

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  0:00 - 0:10  Welcome & Review (10 min)        │
│  ├─ Attendance                                  │
│  ├─ Previous session recap                      │
│  └─ Today's objectives                          │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  0:10 - 0:40  Presentation (30 min)            │
│  ├─ Core concepts                               │
│  ├─ Live demos                                  │
│  └─ Q&A breaks every 10 min                    │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  0:40 - 1:20  Hands-on Exercise (40 min)       │
│  ├─ Exercise introduction (5 min)               │
│  ├─ Guided practice (25 min)                    │
│  └─ Review solutions (10 min)                   │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  1:20 - 1:50  Lab Work (30 min)                │
│  ├─ Lab setup (5 min)                          │
│  ├─ Independent work (20 min)                  │
│  └─ Progress check (5 min)                     │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  1:50 - 2:00  Wrap-up (10 min)                 │
│  ├─ Quiz/Knowledge check                       │
│  ├─ Preview next session                        │
│  └─ Questions & homework                        │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Time Management Tips

- **Running behind?** Cut exercise discussion, not practice time
- **Running ahead?** Add bonus examples or Q&A
- **Students struggling?** Pause and address; skip advanced content
- **Fast learners?** Have extension activities ready

### Module 08: {{MODULE_08_NAME}} (Capstone)

**Session Goals:**
- Students complete capstone project
- Students present their work
- Course wrap-up and certification

**Capstone Facilitation:**
```
0:00 - 0:10   Course review & capstone reminders
0:10 - 1:10   Capstone work time (60 min)
              ├─ Circulate and assist
              ├─ 30-min warning
              └─ 10-min warning
1:10 - 1:50   Presentations (40 min)
              ├─ 5-7 min per student (select 5-6)
              └─ Brief Q&A after each
1:50 - 2:00   Wrap-up
              ├─ Feedback collection
              ├─ Certification info
              └─ Next steps & resources
```

## Assessment Administration

### Quiz Guidelines

- Administer at end of each session
- Allow 10-15 minutes
- Open-note is acceptable
- 70% passing threshold
- Review incorrect answers briefly

### Lab Grading

| Criterion | Points | Notes |
|-----------|--------|-------|
| Completion | 40% | All requirements met |
| Correctness | 30% | Works as expected |
| Best Practices | 20% | Follows course patterns |
| Documentation | 10% | Comments, README |

### Capstone Evaluation

See [Capstone Rubric](assessments/capstone/RUBRIC.md)

- Schedule 15-20 min per student for review
- Provide written feedback within 48 hours
- Use standardized rubric for consistency

---

## Classroom Management

### Engagement Techniques

- **Cold calling:** Gently call on quiet students
- **Think-pair-share:** Discussion before answers
- **Polls:** Quick checks for understanding
- **Breakout rooms:** Small group exercises (virtual)
- **Live coding:** Students follow along

### Handling Challenges

| Situation | Response |
|-----------|----------|
| Student dominates discussion | "Let's hear from others" |
| Student lost/behind | Pair with stronger student |
| Off-topic questions | "Great question - parking lot" |
| Technical difficulties | Have backup plan ready |
| Disengaged student | Direct question, break activity |

### Virtual Classroom Tips

- Camera on encouraged (not required)
- Use chat for questions
- Breakout rooms for exercises
- Screen share for demos
- Record sessions (with consent)
- Take breaks every 45-60 min

## Post-Course

### Feedback Collection
- Send feedback survey within 24 hours
- Review and aggregate results
- Note improvements for next delivery

### Certification Process
1. Verify attendance (80% minimum)
2. Confirm all quizzes passed (70%+)
3. Grade capstone projects
4. Calculate final scores
5. Issue certificates

### Continuous Improvement
- Document what worked well
- Note areas for improvement
- Update materials as needed
- Share insights with course team
